document.discussion_title: Tennis day six: Live coverage and recaps | WWLP.com
document.topic_text: Check out NBCOlympics.com’s full preview for day six of tennis at the 2016 Rio Olympic Games: 10:40 AM On court 1, the United States’ Madison Keys ripped a 5-0 lead in the first set before giving up a number of games. She ultimately won the set 6-0. The United States’ Steve Johnson is dominating his singles match against Russian opponent Evgeny Donskoy. He leads one set to none after a half hour of play.
